1 var simplesmtp = require("../index"),
  2     EventEmitter = require('events').EventEmitter,
  3     utillib = require("util");
  4 
  5 // expose to the world
  6 module.exports = function(port, host, options){
  7     var pool = new SMTPConnectionPool(port, host, options);
  8     return pool;
  9 };
 10 
 11 /**
 12  * <p>Creates a SMTP connection pool</p>
 13  * 
 14  * <p>Optional options object takes the following possible properties:</p>
 15  * <ul>
 16  *     <li><b>secureConnection</b> - use SSL</li>
 17  *     <li><b>name</b> - the name of the client server</li>
 18  *     <li><b>auth</b> - authentication object <code>{user:"...", pass:"..."}</code>
 19  *     <li><b>ignoreTLS</b> - ignore server support for STARTTLS</li>
 20  *     <li><b>debug</b> - output client and server messages to console</li>
 21  *     <li><b>maxConnections</b> - how many connections to keep in the pool</li>
 22  * </ul>
 23  * 
 24  * @constructor
 25  * @namespace SMTP Client Pool module
 26  * @param {Number} [port=25] The port number to connecto to
 27  * @param {String} [host="localhost"] THe hostname to connect to
 28  * @param {Object} [options] optional options object
 29  */
 30 function SMTPConnectionPool(port, host, options){
 31     EventEmitter.call(this);
 32     
 33     /**
 34      * Port number to connect to
 35      * @public
 36      */
 37     this.port = port || 25;
 38     
 39     /**
 40      * Hostname to connect to
 41      * @public
 42      */
 43     this.host = host || "localhost";
 44     
 45     /**
 46      * Options object
 47      * @public
 48      */
 49     this.options = options || {};
 50     this.options.maxConections = this.options.maxConections || 5;
 51     
 52     /**
 53      * An array of connections that are currently idle
 54      * @private
 55      */
 56     this._connectionsAvailable = [];
 57     
 58     /**
 59      * An array of connections that are currently in use
 60      * @private
 61      */
 62     this._connectionsInUse = [];
 63     
 64     /**
 65      * Message queue (FIFO)
 66      * @private
 67      */
 68     this._messageQueue = [];
 69     
 70     /**
 71      * Counter for generating ID values for debugging 
 72      * @private
 73      */
 74     this._idgen = 0;
 75 }
 76 utillib.inherits(SMTPConnectionPool, EventEmitter);
 77 
 78 /**
 79  * <p>Sends a message. If there's any idling connections available
 80  * use one to send the message immediatelly, otherwise add to queue.</p>
 81  * 
 82  * @param {Object} message MailComposer object
 83  * @param {Function} callback Callback function to run on finish, gets an
 84  *        <code>error</code> object as a parameter if the sending failed
 85  *        and on success an object with <code>failedRecipients</code> array as 
 86  *        a list of addresses that were rejected (if any) and 
 87  *        <code>message</code> which indicates the last message received from
 88  *        the server
 89  */
 90 SMTPConnectionPool.prototype.sendMail = function(message, callback){
 91     var connection;
 92     
 93     message.returnCallback = callback;
 94     
 95     if(this._connectionsAvailable.length){
 96         // if available connections pick one
 97         connection = this._connectionsAvailable.pop();
 98         this._connectionsInUse.push(connection);
 99         this._processMessage(message, connection);
100     }else{
101         this._messageQueue.push(message);
102         
103         if(this._connectionsAvailable.length + this._connectionsInUse.length < this.options.maxConections){
104             this._createConnection();
105         }
106     }
107     
108 };
109 
110 /**
111  * <p>Closes all connections</p>
112  */
113 SMTPConnectionPool.prototype.close = function(callback){
114     var connection;
115     
116     // for some reason destroying the connections seem to be the only way :S
117     while(this._connectionsAvailable.length){
118         connection = this._connectionsAvailable.pop();
119         if(connection.socket){
120             connection.socket.destroy();
121         }
122     }
123     
124     while(this._connectionsInUse.length){
125         connection = this._connectionsInUse.pop();
126         if(connection.socket){
127             connection.socket.destroy();
128         }
129     }
130     
131     if(callback){
132         process.nextTick(callback);
133     }
134 };
135 
136 /**
137  * <p>Initiates a connection to the SMTP server and adds it to the pool</p>
138  */
139 SMTPConnectionPool.prototype._createConnection = function(){
140     var connectionOptions = {
141             instanceId: ++this._idgen,
142             debug: !!this.options.debug,
143             ignoreTLS: !!this.options.ignoreTLS,
144             auth: this.options.auth || false,
145             name: this.options.name || false,
146             secureConnection: !!this.options.secureConnection
147         },
148         connection = simplesmtp.connect(this.port, this.host, connectionOptions);
149     
150     connection.on("idle", this._onConnectionIdle.bind(this, connection));
151     connection.on("message", this._onConnectionMessage.bind(this, connection));
152     connection.on("ready", this._onConnectionReady.bind(this, connection));
153     connection.on("error", this._onConnectionError.bind(this, connection));
154     connection.on("end", this._onConnectionEnd.bind(this, connection));
155     connection.on("rcptFailed", this._onConnectionRCPTFailed.bind(this, connection));
156    
157     // as the connection is not ready yet, add to "in use" queue
158     this._connectionsInUse.push(connection);
159 };
160 
161 /**
162  * <p>Processes a message by assigning it to a connection object and initiating
163  * the sending process by setting the envelope</p>
164  * 
165  * @param {Object} message MailComposer message object
166  * @param {Object} connection <code>simplesmtp.connect</code> connection
167  */
168 SMTPConnectionPool.prototype._processMessage = function(message, connection){
169     connection.currentMessage = message;
170     message.currentConnection = connection;
171     
172     // send envelope
173     connection.useEnvelope(message.getEnvelope());
174 };
175 
176 /**
177  * <p>Will be fired on <code>'idle'</code> events by the connection, if 
178  * there's a message currently in queue</p>
179  * 
180  * @event
181  * @param {Object} connection Connection object that fired the event
182  */
183 SMTPConnectionPool.prototype._onConnectionIdle = function(connection){
184     
185     var message = this._messageQueue.shift();
186     
187     if(message){
188         this._processMessage(message, connection);
189     }else{
190         for(var i=0, len = this._connectionsInUse.length; i<len; i++){
191             if(this._connectionsInUse[i] == connection){
192                 this._connectionsInUse.splice(i,1); // remove from list
193                 break;
194             }
195         }
196         this._connectionsAvailable.push(connection);
197     }
198     
199 };
200 
201 /**
202  * <p>Will be called when not all recipients were accepted</p>
203  * 
204  * @event
205  * @param {Object} connection Connection object that fired the event
206  * @param {Array} addresses Failed addresses as an array of strings
207  */
208 SMTPConnectionPool.prototype._onConnectionRCPTFailed = function(connection, addresses){
209     if(connection.currentMessage){
210         connection.currentMessage.failedRecipients = addresses;
211     }
212 };
213 
214 /**
215  * <p>Will be called when the client is waiting for a message to deliver</p>
216  * 
217  * @event
218  * @param {Object} connection Connection object that fired the event
219  */
220 SMTPConnectionPool.prototype._onConnectionMessage = function(connection){
221     if(connection.currentMessage){
222         connection.currentMessage.streamMessage();
223         connection.currentMessage.pipe(connection);
224     }
225 };
226 
227 /**
228  * <p>Will be called when a message has been delivered</p>
229  * 
230  * @event
231  * @param {Object} connection Connection object that fired the event
232  * @param {Boolean} success True if the message was queued by the SMTP server
233  * @param {String} message Last message received from the server
234  */
235 SMTPConnectionPool.prototype._onConnectionReady = function(connection, success, message){
236     var error, responseObj = {};
237     if(connection.currentMessage && connection.currentMessage.returnCallback){
238         if(success){
239 
240             if(connection.currentMessage.failedRecipients){
241                 responseObj.failedRecipients = connection.currentMessage.failedRecipients;
242             }
243             if(message){
244                 responseObj.message = message;
245             }
246              
247             connection.currentMessage.returnCallback(null, responseObj);
248             
249         }else{
250             error = new Error("Message delivery failed");
251             error.name = "DeliveryError";
252             connection.currentMessage.returnCallback(error); 
253         }
254     }
255     connection.currentMessage = false;
256 };
257 
258 /**
259  * <p>Will be called when an error occurs</p>
260  * 
261  * @event
262  * @param {Object} connection Connection object that fired the event
263  * @param {Object} error Error object
264  */
265 SMTPConnectionPool.prototype._onConnectionError = function(connection, error){
266     var message = connection.currentMessage;
267     connection.currentMessage = false;
268     
269     // clear a first message from the list, otherwise an infinite loop will emerge
270     if(!message){
271         message = this._messageQueue.shift();
272     }
273     
274     if(message && message.returnCallback){
275         message.returnCallback(error);
276     }
277 };
278 
279 /**
280  * <p>Will be called when a connection to the client is closed</p>
281  * 
282  * @event
283  * @param {Object} connection Connection object that fired the event
284  */
285 SMTPConnectionPool.prototype._onConnectionEnd = function(connection){
286     var removed = false, i, len;
287     
288     // if in "available" list, remove
289     for(i=0, len = this._connectionsAvailable.length; i<len; i++){
290         if(this._connectionsAvailable[i] == connection){
291             this._connectionsAvailable.splice(i,1); // remove from list
292             removed = true;
293             break;
294         }
295     }
296     
297     if(!removed){
298         // if in "in use" list, remove
299         for(i=0, len = this._connectionsInUse.length; i<len; i++){
300             if(this._connectionsInUse[i] == connection){
301                 this._connectionsInUse.splice(i,1); // remove from list
302                 removed = true;
303                 break;
304             }
305         }
306     }
307     
308     // if there's still unprocessed mail and available connection slots, create
309     // a new connection
310     if(this._messageQueue.length && 
311       this._connectionsInUse.length + this._connectionsAvailable.length < this.options.maxConections){
312         this._createConnection();
313     }
314 };
